Name: Punderdome: Food Fight Expansion Pack
Description:
The smash-hit party game Punderdome has proven that people can’t get enough of silly wordplay. Finally, here is a Punderdome expansion pack tied to one of the most popular themes ripe for punning: food. Add this pack of 50 cards that includes 50 food-themed nouns and 50 punny Q&As to the core game for a fun, more accessible way to play. (This expansion pack includes a link to access the original game instructions online.)

With 50 yummy nouns and 50 groan-worthy jokes, this Punderdome expansion pack proves that wordplay is here to stay. Add these 50 cards to the original game for a more dynamic experience.

Name: Meet at the Inn
Description:
Many heroic adventures begin with a ragtag group of folks gathering to discuss their plans to help save the land from peril! And many of those meetings took place at the town's local inn! In Meet at the Inn, you're the adventurer freshly setting out on your journey... but will you mostly encounter simple beasts and uneventful landscapes, or will you be trapped by a Null Zone, brave the Cavern of the Abyss, or command the power of the Genie?

Meet at the Inn is comprised of 30 unique cards, each with unique Trait combinations and some with unique abilities. The goal of the game is to empty your hand of cards, but that is much easier said than done.

Each turn you will only play 1 card from your hand if it matches a Trait with the top card of the Play Pile. If you cannot, you must draw a card from the Deck. Certain cards can remain in play with global effects, called "Decrees". Some cards allow you to play out of turn to empty your hand faster, these are "Chain" abilities.

There is also a Discard Pile, which helps get cards out of play, because when the Deck is empty and a player must draw a card, the Play Pile is reshuffled!

Set up and teaching the game takes less than 5 minutes. Playing a game takes roughly 5 minutes per player. But Meet at the Inn really shines when you've played it a few times with the same friends because your strategy will adapt to the meta of your opponent.

—description from the designer

Name: Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy Rides Again
Description:
Think there ain't much on these here plains that you haven't seen, heard, or shot at? Put your skills to the test in the solo version of Circle The Wagons.

Contains:

     3 scenario cards originally released as part of the Board Game of the Month Club.



Put your skills to the test against a wily opponent in the solo expansion for Circle the Wagons.

Lone Cowboy is a series of solo expansions for Circle the Wagons and Second Shot. Each set introduces new scenario cards. These tell the player which scoring conditions to use in the game as well as adding specific rules to determine the behavior of the non-human opponent. The solo game is played over two rounds but otherwise follows standard gameplay.

To setup a game using any of the Lone Cowboy sets, choose 1 scenario card and place it in the center. Find the two scoring conditions listed on the scenario and add them to the center.

Deal out 8 cards in a circle. The player drafts and places cards on their turn as normal, with any skipped cards going to the opponent’s pile. The opponent follows specific drafting criteria to determine which card they take. Skipped cards go to the player as normal.

Once all 8 cards have been taken, deal the remaining 8 cards in a circle and repeat the process. After all 16 cards are gone, the opponent scores based on the scenario card as well as for the three most common territories in their pile. The player scores their town as normal. If the player’s score is higher, they win!

Name: Punderdome: Wild Things Expansion Pack
Description:
The smash-hit party game Punderdome has proven that people can’t get enough of silly wordplay. Finally, here is a Punderdome expansion pack tied to one of the most popular themes that is perfect for punning: animals. Add this pack of 50 cards that includes 50 animal-themed nouns and 50 punny Q&As to the core game for a fun, more accessible way to play. (This expansion pack includes a link to access the original game instructions online.)

With 50 animal-themed nouns and 50 groan-worthy jokes, this Punderdome expansion pack proves that wordplay is here to stay. Add these 50 cards to the mother game for a more dynamic experience.

Name: Lieber bairisch sterben
Description:
Lieber bairisch sterben (Better to die Bavarian) covers the Bavarian Peasant Revolt of the early 18th century in which three sides fought for power: the Imperial Austrian Army, the Prince-Elector's forces, and the rebellious peasants.

Players don't represent a particular faction, but instead must court the factions' leadership each turn, acquiring counters of the corresponding color. The main shareholder is awarded the leadership for that turn, and in the course of a game, the leader of a side can change multiple times.

Through their faction, a player tries to gain points, earning them for the capture of the most important towns: Munich, Regensburg, Passau, Straubing, Landshut, and Burghausen. To do so,  you must to occupy these with a unit. Occupying a town brings money into the bank, with which you can pay for the cost of the troops. Battles are dealt with via a unique card mechanism.

Lieber bairisch sterben is a completely reworked version of the 1988 game of the same name.

Name: 1837-Saxonia
Description:
18SX Saxony is an 18XX design that contains thirteen corporations, with up to ten of them being put into play over the course of the game, with "concessions" being made to determine who may start which companies distributed in a start-packet system.

The game has a unique track system in which directors have to choose between single and double track, with those choices having an effect on route length.

18SX Saxony is a heavy reworking of 18SX from the same author.

—description from the publisher

Name: Patchwork Doodle: Plus
Description:
Mini expansion from Lookout Magazine "Ausguck"
Cards with new shapes and an additional special ability.

Name: Dreamscape: Deep Dreams Mini-Expansion
Description:
This mini expansion is comprised of 5 new Dreamcards.

Each card has a specific building challenge. Players will draw these and try to successfully build the shown pattern on their Dreamscape board. Dreamcards come in 3 levels of difficulty, easily identified by the back on the card.

Was available by itself for purchase at Essen Spiel 2019.

Name: Connexion
Description:
Connexion is a game that tests the complicity that reigns in duos of players. Through the various games on offer, players will have to prove that their connection is strongest by scoring points, sometimes by having the same answers as their teammate, sometimes by guessing their answers. The first duo to join the center of his line of complicity is likely to win the game! Which duo will be the first to connect? The ideal game to generate laughter, discussions and most importantly, give rise to unexpected discoveries!

—description from the publisher

Name: Leo: The Snake
Description:
Contained in Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box

Components: 5 path tiles.

SET-UP: Mix the 5 path tiles with the snake together with the other path tiles. Then, as usual, lay out the path, which is now 5 tiles longer.
 Game Play: If you turn over a path tile and it shows a snake, you always lose 2 hours. The color of the just-played card doesn’t matter.

Name: Puerto Rico: Buccaneer
Description:
Place the role placard “Buccaneer” with the other starting role placards. Follow all other rules for the number of players in the game. When a player chooses the buccaneer role, they choose one of the four options to perform on that turn. This action applies only to that player and does not affect the other players.

Piracy: Remove all goods from any transport ship. Store up to three of the removed goods.

Plunder: Remove all goods from the trading house (not warehouse). Take one victory point for each removed good.

Raid: Reduce the number of colonists on the colonist ship to the minimum number (= number of players). Keep up to 3 of the removed colonists and use them immediately on your island (but do not add them to San Juan!).  Return any remaining removed colonists to the supply.

Kidnapping: “Catch” any unused role by placing it in front of you. Take all the doubloons on this role. If an opponent still wants to use this role, take additional 3 doubloons from the bank. If this role was not used until the end of the round, play it by yourself.

In addition:
If the buccaneer card was not chosen, do not place a doubloon on it at the end of the round.

Anyone who has taken the buccaneer role, may only take it again, after it has been taken by another player. When a player takes the buccaneer role they also take the “reward” card. That small card stays with the player until another player takes the buccaneer role.

Name: Glen More II: Chronicles – Promo 2: Lowland Clans
Description:
This promo consists of 6 additional Clan Fields (with no text), depicting the Lowland clans, that may be added to the game and 2 additional Chronicles: Ol' Jamey's Single Cask Reserve and The Penny Mobs.

—user summary

Name: Dumeklemmer-Citylauf
Description:
The Dumeklemmer-Citylauf was a promotion game for the Ratinger Spieletage 2019 board game convention in Ratingen, North-Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. The players have to move on a map and visit different sights in the city of Ratingen.

At the start of the turn the player perform a dice roll to get action points according to the number of dice pips, which can be used to move their pawn one the map one step per action point. It is possible to save up to 8 action points for the next turn. A player can only visit one of the 12 sights, if they are not more than 3 steps away. On the upper map border is a column for each sight. When the turn ends on one of the sights, the player places a token to the lowermost cell of this sight, if they have not already a token there. For example, on the Protestant Church the first player gets two victory point, the second player one, the third player five and the fourth player eight victory points. However, at the end of the turn, a player can pay six action points to move one their tokens one step higher. Tokens of other players are skipped. For example, if the second cell of the Protestant Church is occupied, a player can jump from two to five victory points. Players also get two bonus points for each different city district they have visited (sights have different colors.) As soon a player reaches the city hall (where also the Ratinger Spieletage took place), they cannot move on the map anymore, they get 4 victory points and place at the start of each of their turns one of their tokens a special cell, which gives one victory point per token.

As soon one player has placed all of their 8 tokens, the current round is played to the end. The player with the most Victory points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Ratinger Speed Puzzle
Description:
Competitive puzzle game for two to four teams of two players each. It contains four different puzzles with eight square tiles each.

There are four skill challenges to play the game.


     Pick the correct tiles (pattern recognition)
     Complete puzzles (speed matching)
     Puzzle with index finger only (dexterity)
     One team member is blindfolded and the other has to conduct (team-based game)


The team which collects the most points in these four challenges wins the game.

—user summmary

Name: Monopoly: Gent
Description:
The city of "Artevelde" is for sale! Ghent, the proud city, is maybe one of the most varied cities of Flanders.
A historical center, which dates from the Middle Ages, is combined with modern architeccture, art and a vibrant atmosphere.

Monopoly Gent is the ideal way to (re)discover Ghent in a different way. Visit the "Sint-Baafs" cathedral, buy the "Gravensteen", build a hotel on the "Korenmarkt", go shopping in the "Veldstraat" or treat your friends during the "Gentse Feesten"! This version of Monopoly takes you to all the beauty the city of Ghent has to offer.

This unique edition is the gadget for every inhabitant of Ghent or Ghent-lover.

Have a lot of fun during playing the game and especially: "Nie neute, Nie pleuje"!

Name: Fish, Farewell, Forever
Description:
According to the rules, Fish, Farewell, Forever, is a "single-player card game designed to free the masses of their suffering from earthly desires." The game is made up of a deck of 30 cards, with virtue cards, desire cards, and understanding cards.

Players play through a deck of cards hoping to liberate cards to The Beyond.  Once the deck runs out, the player loses unless they can move 2 cards from The Beyond over the Styx and onto The Far Shore.

A player wins if they can liberate all cards.  "Elevated" wins are also possible, which allow the play to liberate non-card components, such as the rule book and box insert.

Name: Zooloretto: Capybara
Description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, given for free by Abacus at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

This expansion consists of 1 tile with a Capybara.
Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player, who fill his 6-space enclosure takes the Capybara enclosure from the middle of the table as a bonus.

The owner of the Capybara enclosure can pay twice in the entire game one coin to place a tile they have just drawn on a delivery truck that already has 3 tiles on it. The coins remain on the Capybara enclosure until the end of the game as a reminder.

Scoring: The coins on the Capybara enclosure are not considered during scoring.

One side is English (Capybara), other side is German (Wasserschwein).

Name: Foothills: Aberystwyth
Description:
Originally available at Essen Spiel 2019.

2 new cards with the Cliff Railway, one with the rules and one to add to the beginning of the railway.

Name: Konja: Spin Dähl promo card
Description: Extra Relic card, which gives you a gold token.

Name: Holiday Fever: A Family Tradition
Description:
Players roll the die and move clockwise around the board, following the instructions of the space you land on.  The outer edge of the board represents life during the holiday season.  Players acquire debts, shop, pay bills, decorate a Christmas tree and earn Christmas spirit by giving speeches, sharing stories and singing Christmas carols.

The game ends when someone lands on Christmas. You win by giving your family the most valuable Christmas which is calculated by the value of your gifts, tree, stocking and Christmas spirit.

After the game ends, families are encouraged to flip the scoreboard and share something noteworthy about the game for keepsakes for your family to cherish and make a family tradition.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Stack Family
Description:
On a sunny spring morning the Stack family wants to play outside with their balloon and kite. Could it be that the toy box was not closed properly? It seems the wind blew all our toys high into the tree. Help the parents and children climb on each others shoulders and reach everything before the sun sets.

The Stack Family is a game for the whole family. It is easy to learn, but not always easy to win! Together you think of how to get all the items out of the tree in time.
Players take turns in spinning the wheel to see which family member they may move. By moving the family members and stacking them, the family can reach high enough to grab their toys from the tree. If no one can be moved by following the rules, then the sun continues it orbit and when the sun sets, the family loses.

Through the special and playful design the game is also suited for free play.

Name: Similo: Fables – Robin Hood Promo
Description: Promo card included in the Essen '19 copy of Spielbox. Later available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: L.O.L. Surprise: Sleepover Surprise
Description:
The L.O.L. Surprise! Sleepover Surprise game is an active party game where kids try to complete the most hilarious, wacky, and fun challenges to win. Players try to complete L.O.L. Surprise! themed challenges that'll have everyone dancing, laughing, and doing so much more, over 10 rounds. The player with the most points after 10 rounds wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mecha Riders
Description:
It is a two player strategy game. Each player will be the operator of four Mechas that will fight and make tactical movements to eliminate the enemy's power supply tower, however defending their own tower at all costs.

The system has 18 movement range cards and 12 attack range cards. By round each player is required to use 5 of them. 3 of movement and 2 of attack.
In each round one card will be played per turn. It does not matter the order or the Mecha with which you use it. The general rule is that you are required to use the 5 cards and pay the energy of the cost of the card. If you cannot move or attack, you must discard a card and lose your turn.
When a round is over. The player with the initiative must pass it to the other player. Each one must take again 3 movement cards and 2 attack cards. And start the new round.
Every 3 rounds there is an energy cycle. Before starting the fourth round (if there is still no winner) the tower's energy levels and Mechas still alive returns to their original value.

Each Mecha has its own characteristics. Health, Energy, Special Skill, Attack Power. Players have to make tactical moves and prepare a strategy to eliminate the enemy's tower or eliminate the Mechas to win a game.

—description from the designer

Name: Flick Wars
Description:
Flick Wars is a strategy and tactics dexterity game with six factions that range from humans to mechs to alien races. Each faction has a unique set of units.

This is a listing for the 2 player print and play version that was temporarily posted to the kickstarter for the game.

Name: Backyard Birding
Description:
Play. Attract. Learn!

Explore the beauty of the Pacific Northwest's most engaging birds while seeing how many you can attract to your own backyard.

In Backyard Birding, use different Backyard cards to build an environment most suitable for the largest variety of birds.

Collect points by attracting more birds to your Yard; the more common they are in one of the four seasons, the more points they're worth!

But beware: dangers such as birds of prey and house cats lurk that make it more difficult to attract more birds.

The player with the most points in their Yard at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Die Befreiung der Rietburg: Varkur – der dunkle Magier
Description: Mini-expansion, consisting of one card that increases the difficulty.

Name: Die Befreiung der Rietburg: Der alte Wehrturm
Description: Mini-expansion, consisting of one card that decreases the difficulty.

Name: Shaun das Schaf: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
The animals of the Mossy Bottom Farm would like to take a nice group photo - but it is not so easy to get a nice motive together! Each player has his own card display, in which he collects different animals with the highest possible card values. But the teammates can quickly change their own display and their card values!

Each player has three cards on his hand. On his turn he plays one card in his or an opponents display. He can start a new pile or place the card on a pile with the same colour. The value of a display can be increased but also reduced. Afterwards he draws a new hand card.

Important: It always counts only the top card of a pile! And if at any point in a player's deck two cards or stacks of cards show the same number, these two cards (stacks) must be combined into one stack!

The round ends immediately when the first player has a display with six stacks OR the draw pile is empty. Players get points for the top card on each stack - but only if they have managed to collect all three colours!
The game ends when one or more players reach 150 points.

Name: Hadrian's Line
Description:
84 AD - The Picts defend their homeland against the tyranny of the invading Romans. As leaders of different Pict tribes, earn glory through battle, take over territory, and fight back against your aggressors. Rival Pict tribes also vie for glory, but beware: all players lose if the Romans advance too far into Pictland.

Play is broken into two phases-
Player Phase (all players take 1 turn)
Roman Phase

Player Phase:
Players take turns completing both these steps then another player takes a turn.
Actions
Scoring

Actions:
Players take turns performing 3 actions in any order and any number of times.  
Available Actions:
March - Move warriors to different areas
Attack - Attack another player's warriors
Recruit - Gain more warriors
Plan (Only once per turn) - Draw a strategy card

Scoring:
Every area you have a majority gain 1 point. Certain areas affect scoring.

Roman Phase: The Romans attack the entire row of areas and roll dice depending on the round number or the number of all warriors in an area whichever is highest.

Game End: All players lose if the Romans advance 2 rows. Whichever player has the highest points at the end of 6 rounds wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Infludance classic
Description: You are trying to get your animal across the game board. However, the only rule is applied: Don´t go forwards! If you jump into the next puddle, you will splash the other animals. Sometimes you will splash yourself which is the right way to reach the target. You will learn to identify the animal footprints in this Indian detective game. Whose footprints are on the board and which direction do they keep?

Name: Arena: The Contest – Imperial Box
Description:
The Imperial Box accommodates all the ton of Kickstarter-Exclusive stuff unlocked as Stretch Goals and Community Goals during the Arena: the Contest Campaign, such as Heroes from the Bruiser Combat Role, the feared Emperor, and the even-more-feared Baleroth huge miniature.

—description from the publisher

Name: Catan: Starfarers – Asteroid Fields
Description: Mini expansion for Catan Starfarers (2019) with 17 scout cards and one extra victory point card. The first player, with the most stars on their scout cards (at least five stars) receives the card Größter Kundschafter, which is worth 1 victory point.

Name: Shaolin Chess
Description:
Shaolin Chess theme is a fantasy style, shaolin mortal combat. It combines some design aspects of Chinese Checkers with the moveset mechanics of Chess. The pieces representing some of the 5 most iconic Shaolin Styles: The Tiger, The Dragon, The Crane, The Snake and The Monkey.

Game play - Designed around an arena, up to 6 players compete in various (5) game modes for the title of Grand Master. Each player is given a set of "5 guard" pieces representing the styles. You must battle your way to victory in a blood bath of a game.

Goal of the game - To exercise a sense of strategy and understanding of others by building small inclusive communities.

Game modes - There are (5) different game modes. Each game mode can be made into a team match except for "Duel".

Duel - a game mode that resembles chess more than anything. You must capture your opponent's Grand Master piece. Accommodates between 2-3 players.

BloodBath - Last man standing wins. 
Accommodates up to 6 players.

Dojo - Capture the flag like game, where your pieces must infiltrate an opponent's home base by reaching the furthest point in their dojo.
Accommodates up to 6 players.

Siege - An attacking Vs. Defender game, where an offensive team must capture all defending home bases, and the defending team must keep their bases safe.
Accommodates up to 6 players.

Enlightenment - A king of the hill type game, where players must race to the middle of the board, capture the grand master piece and keep control of the GM long enough to direct it back to their Dojos goal.

—description from the designer

Name: The Game of Gates
Description:
Players take turns turning gates and moving pieces within the open paths created. The game is won by players moving their piece to the opposing players base, or by pinning the opposing players piece.

The game takes place on a 10x10 grid board with 45 gates. Player's bases are located in the far left corner of the back rows on each side of the board. Pieces are placed on their respective bases at the start of the game.

A turn consists of two actions in this order: a player turns any gate on the board, then a player moves their piece anywhere along the open path at least one space. Players take turns doing this until there is a winner.

Name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Neko Harbour 2
Description: Promo Card Seaside Town: An extra place to visit and see 4 penguins.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Spike! Journal #7
Description:
Take a Blood Bowl tour to the New World in Spike! Journal 7. Guest editor Pterry Dactyl plunges into the jungle to explore the exciting history of the game, rumoured to have been invented by the Slann and their Lizardmen servants.

The Lizardmen are ready to make a splash on the Blood Bowl scene. Combining the cold-blooded killer instinct and steely-eyed defence of Saurus Blockers with Skinks possessing speed and agility to rival the fastest teams on the pitch, the illustrious Lustrians play the game like they were spawned ready to play... because they were.

This issue is packed with everything you need to know about Lizardmen in Blood Bowl, and then some!


     A Lustrian Adventure: setting out the broad history of Blood Bowl in the New World, and the various cold-blooded creatures that play it.
     Background on famous Lizardmen teams, including the Gwaka’moli Crater Gators, plus stats, special rules and Star Player profiles!
     Star Player Spotlight: Anqi Panqi - This massive Temple Guard Saurus is just what you need to shore up your line of scrimmage, and he only plays for Lizardmen. Take a look at his history, stats, and in-game cost.
     Chat With the Rat: Hackspit ‘the Scribbler’ Quillchewer interviews Georgie Johns, an adventurer-archeologist who specializes in Lustrian history. He asks her a series of very oddly pointed questions about the history of Skaven-Lizardmen relations in the New World.
     Star Player Spotlight: Glotl Stop - This Kroxigor doesn’t come cheap, but once you see what he can do for Lizardmen and Amazon teams, you’ll understand why. Dig into his background, rules and cost in this issue.
     Lustrian Leagues: Run a season in Lustria and see how (some would say) the game is meant to be played! Take in the full rules for running matches in the temple-stadia, including rainforest weather patterns and an alternative kick-off table.
     A Skink in the Plan: Top tips for getting the most out of the variety of players available to Lizardmen coaches. Here’s a hint: hide the quick, squishy little ones behind the big, scary ones until the last moment. You’re welcome!
     Star Player Spotlight: Drull and Dribl - Get two for the price of one with twin Skinks! They’re surprisingly violent in all the right ways. Take a look at their unusual story, stats and the cost to add them to your roster.
     Travellers from Beyond the Stars - A true and completely unbiased account of the Slann, the most powerful mages that ever lived, which we weren’t at all compelled to write by powerful sorceries. Plus, how to hire them as an Inducement for both Lizardmen and Amazon teams.
     Dirt from the Dugout: Mindy Piewhistle dishes about the conflict between the priests of the Old Ones and those of Nuffle. There are… differences of opinion when it comes to the ‘right’ way to play.
     Coffin Corner and Tatzina Babarini’s guide to Lustrian Style: You’re not going to find coverage like this anywhere else, folks. Get the inside scoop on these mysterious players and their home.
     Classic Commentaries: Bob Bifford’s shares a riveting tale of a memorable game played against the Ssservants of the Ssslann. We double checked, and that’s definitely how it’s spelled.


Key Features

    Rules and stats to field a Lizardmen team of your own
    History of the Gwaka’moli Crater Gators and a slew of Star Players
    Fascinating background on Lustria, and the origins of Blood Bowl itself


—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Lizardmen Team Card Pack
Description:
Keep your head in the game instead of flipping through books. This crucial deck of 45 cards is loaded with reference material to help you make the most of your Lizardmen team. Easily look up your player stats, Star Players, Magical Memorabilia and Benefits of Training.

This pack also includes 8 Special Play cards, which can be used by any team!

CONTENTS

     Reference cards for Lizardmen Skink Runners, Saurus Blockers, Chameleon Skinks and Kroxigors
     Reference cards for Star Players like Anqi Panqi, Glotl Stop, and the Skink twins Drull and Dribl
     Blank cards to create your own players
     1 team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
     4 Magical Memorabilia cards: Helm of the Stegadon, Sotek's Sacred Jars, Cursed Totem, Carnosaur Shield
     4 Benefits of Training cards: Catch Me If You Slann, A Lizardman's Tail, Dino-might!, Do You Think He Saurus?
     8 universal Special Play cards
     The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse


Key Features

    Full set of reference cards for your Lizardmen team
    Includes blank cards for all Lizardmen positions
    Speed up your games and keep track of your roster, players, and special rules


—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Goblin Team Card Pack
Description:
Coaching goblins can be a chaotic mess in all the right ways. Keep that mayhem to the pitch and get organised with this deck of 44 reference cards. Keep track of stats for each position, Star Players, Dirty Tricks and Miscellaneous Mayhem.

This pack also includes 6 Special Play cards, which can be used by any team!

This set contains:

     Reference cards for Goblin, Bomma, Looney, Fanatic, Doom Diver, Pogoer, ‘Ooligan and, of course, Troll players
     Reference cards for Star Players like Fungus the Loon, The Black Gobbo, and Bomber Dribblesnot
     Blank cards to create your own players
     1 team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
     3 Dirty Tricks cards: Honest, Guv! Hideous Tittering, Total Con-Troll
     3 Miscellaneous Mayhem cards: Oi! Where'd 'E Go?, Fanatic On The Loose, Mushroom Brew.
     6 universal Special Play cards
     The all-important card that explains how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse


Key Features

    Full set of reference cards for your Goblin team
    Includes blank cards for all eight positions
    Speed up your games and keep track of your roster, players and special rules


—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Head Coach's Rules & Accessories Pack
Description:
Blood Bowl is the classic game of fantasy football. It’s all about strategy, grit, and – above all – heinous violence. Two players coach their teams to victory on the pitch, utilising every natural advantage, dirty trick, and cheap shot they can come up with to get the ball into the End Zone, or take out the entire opposing team.

This set contains all of the rules, gaming aids and accessories you need to get the most out of your games.

The 80-page Head Coach’s Handbook comes in a convenient A5-size to make it easy to handle whilst gaming. This essential tome is packed with the basic rules you need to play, plus extra rules for creating your own team and hiring staff. You'll also find a description of Special Play cards, and learn how to use them in your games. Official league rules help you set up and organise a season of gaming, complete with a dedicated stadium and sponsorship deals. There’s a handy chart of all the many Skills in the game, rosters for every single team that’s been released so far, plus every Star Player. Finally, there's even a section on the history of Blood Bowl to read while you're taking care of business that doesn't require your full attention!

But enough about the book. This box also contains loads of tokens to represent Inducements, player, game and weather status, re-rolls and tonnes more. You'll also find a super handy cheat sheet to look up the rules and tables you use most, a 50-page blank roster pad (go ahead and test that crazy team idea you've been kicking around), and a set of spare range, scatter and throw-in templates.

Key Features

    Condensed rules, gaming aids and reference material
    Rosters for every team, and Star Player rules
    Tokens to keep track of all of the craziness Blood Bowl is known for


—description from the publisher

Name: Victory in Hell: The First Battle of the Naktong River, August 5-19, 1950
Description:
“There will be no more retreating, withdrawal, readjustment of line or whatever you call it. There are no lines behind which we can retreat. This is not going to be a Dunkirk or Bataan. A retreat to Pusan would result in one of the greatest butcheries in history. We must fight to the end. We must fight as a team. If some of us die, we will die fighting together.” – US General Walton “Bulldog” Walker, July 31, 1950.

South Korean forces withdrew to a small perimeter centered on the South Korean port of Pusan. By August the North Korean forces, although bloodied by repeated US airstrikes and weakened by stragglers from their swift advance, were massed for what many thought would be a final offensive to take the rest of South Korea. The main focus of the North Korean attack was along the Naktong River where a small bridge head had been secured earlier. Victory here could insure that there would be only one Korea, ruled by Communist leader Kim Il Sung. A UN victory could buy time and set the stage for a counter-offensive that might send the Communists back and free South Korea. Can you do as well or better?

Each copy of "Victory in Hell" is composed of the following:


     One 11 by 17 inch map.
     One Players’ Aid Sheet with game tracks and terrain identification.
     80 un-mounted double-sided units.
     6 pages of rules.


Infantry units are regiments, all armor units are companies. A hex is approximately a third of a mile across. Each turn represents one day of time.

Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and determine some game events. A six-sided die is used to resolve game combats and other actions.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Standard Deck Activation System (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: Rush M.D.: The Kickstarter promos
Description:
Stretch goals that were reached during the 2019-Kickstarter campaign and consists of:


     A cardboard Ambulance
     A cardboard MRI-scanner
     New patients
     New Diagnosis cards (new types like inconclusive results or further exams)
     New module: Surgical complications (after an operation draw a card to see of any complications have occurred)

Name: Rush M.D.: Essen 2019 Promocard
Description:
A New patient that was given for free at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

It's a red patient that requires an operation and needs as well a kidney, heart, bone and lung. She will grant you 2 VP when you succeed.

Name: Portraitgeist
Description:
One player will be taking on the role of a pesky poltergeist, Vincent VanGhost. Vincent has come to this mansion, to free his ghostly companions from their Portrait prisons in order to help him complete his ghastly rituals throughout the house. Vincent will be moving about the house in secret,  using a separate pad to keep track of his movements, trying to free the other ghosts from their paintings. The painting ghosts will be moving about the house too but unlike Vincent, their movement is on the board for all to see. All the ghosts also have a unique movement advantage over the hunters, they can move through walls. As the ghosts are released freed, they will assist Vincent in completing rituals. To win the game they must complete 3 out of 5 rituals in 9 rounds of play. The other players will share control of the 4 hunters on the board. Each of these hunters has one of 10 different special powers to choose from giving each game a different way to combat Vincent and his ghostly pals. But if you think Vincent is without his own powers and tricks think again. Vincent too has different once per game powers to choose from, getting 3 to use each game. For the hunters to win they will need to locate Vincent and zap him, or hold him and his spooky pals at bay until the time limit expires.

—description from the designer

Name: Langland Rommé
Description:
Animals that get longer - this is only available at Langland Rommé. Even children from the age of four can get to know the famous card game classic here - without any numbers at all. You need a head and a back to be able to lay out an animal. With bellies you can extend it as long as you like. Due to the funny animals, which are getting longer and longer, children do not need any numerical knowledge to play Langland Rommé. With a variant for advanced children, older children also have fun with it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Langland Lotto
Description:
At Langland Lotto the body parts of the animals have gotten confused while playing. Each player therefore tries to form two complete animals from the individual body parts. Each round one of the animal tiles is uncovered. Whoever owns the tableau with the corresponding animal may take it. The winner is the first player to fill out both of his animal tableaux completely and correctly.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dead Men's Revenge
Description:
Quick Explanation of Dead Men's Revenge
After battling in BULLSHIP! to obtain the legendary Black Lagoon, players embark on their ships to race to Treasure Island, where they will amass riches and become the most powerful pirate king in the world.
The player who scored the last place from the original BULLSHIP! has come into contact with a deadly virus that has converted them into a contagious ZOMBIE!  The Zombie could care less about Treasure Island - they solely want to convert all other players into Zombies and turn the sea into a zombie-infested undead haven.
The gameplay remains the same, however, with a twist.  Each non-zombie player will move forward on the map only by winning BULLSHIP over another player. If a player loses to a Zombie player, they will instantly become a Zombie and their goal is to convert all other player's into Zombies.  (Zombies VS Pirates VS Pirates)
The player who won first place from the original BULLSHIP! starts off closer to treasure island than the other players. (well deserved!)

Name: Gnome Grown
Description:
The new development is ready and you and your neighbours can finally move into your lovely new homes. The kitchens are sparkling, but the gardens are bare. Over the fence, you brag about your greenfingers and instantly a ‘friendly’ competition is afoot. Compete with your neighbours to create the best garden and be crowned head gardener before the gnome gets to the end of the garden path.

Bid for turn order, then select actions that enable you to develop and fill your garden by landscaping, adding features and attracting animals. Collect and place sets of tiles to complete hidden personal objectives within fenced sections of the garden to score points. Most points wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chip Monks
Description:
A fast-paced dice pool building game in which you gather resources and learn recipes so that your chipmunks can brew beer.

You'll use worker placement to gather ingredients, learn recipes, build your dice pool, move around a modular board representing the monastery interior and surround grounds, steal resources, and earn points.

Using the dice pool that you've built, you'll choose up to two actions per round as you try to score the highest point total from brewing different types of beers.

Name: Balance of Command
Description:
A promotional game for a Kickstarter animated film "A Winter of Empires".

The game is a simple fighting game between two spaceships. Manage the resources of your ship and try and guess your opponent's next maneuver. Claim victory by destroying your opponent's ship.

Name: ヘイッDJ (Hey DJ)
Description:
In this game, players are newbie DJs and begin practice sessions.
We will play a song card one by one in turn, but let's play songs that can be “mixed” with the previous songs as much as possible.
If it breaks somewhere, it will be scored by the person who played the song before that.

You can “mix” a song card that appears in play if you can put out a song with the same genre (color) or theme (icon) from your hand. Even if you cannot mix, be sure to play the card.
If the mix fails, the bunch of cards that have been in play until then will be scored.
The player who gets the score is the last player in the bundle.

Basically, each card is one point, but a card that matches the “My Genre Card” distributed in advance can be counted as two points.
Repeat until the deck is gone and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer (translated)

Name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Expansion
Description: Sword & Shield is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Collection Sword & Shield. The set introduces Generation VIII and Pokémon-V in the card game.

Name: Level 7 [Omega Protocol]: Known Enemy Bonus Content
Description:
A pack released through the Kickstarter campaign to celebrate the second edition of LEVEL 7 [OMEGA PROTOCOL].

Contains:


     Exclusive Commander figure
     Cardboard sheet containing 2 rooms, 2 dashboard tiles, doors and tokens
     24 small cards (3 Room cards, 17 Kit cards, 4 Investigate cards)
     13 alternate enemy cards
     Exclusive white die
     Bonus Content booklet collecting existing support materials that had been printed in other publications or online into a single scenario booklet.
     Revised Rulebook
     3 previously released promo cards (1 Room, 1 Investigate, 1 Kit)

Name: SQU
Description:
INTRODUCTION

In SQU, players alternate turns placing stones on the board with the aim of creating the largest ‘squ’, an arrengement of 4 stones in the corners of a square.

SQU adds up to the family of other ‘square-creation games’ such as Dakapo (Stephan Miksch) or Quartetto (Artyom Tchebotaryov). It also uses the 1-2-2-2… piece-entering mechanism of Connect6 to balance the game.

EQUIPMENT

10x10 orthogonal board (checkered for clarity) with an inner 8x8 board for shorter games, 50 red discs, 50 black discs, 4 red pyramids, 4 black pyramids, carrying case.

HOW TO PLAY

Definition: a Squ is an arrangement of 4 discs of the same colour on the corners of a square with the sides parallel to the sides ot the board (this is, the square must not be rotated).

Each player has an allocated colour (Red or Black).

The board starts empty. Decide the size of the board (8x8 or 10x10).

Red places one disc onto an empty cell of the board. Then, starting with Black, players alternate turns placing 2 discs of their colour onto empty spaces until either one of the players resigns or all cells are occupied.

If, at the end of a player’s turn (after placing both stones) a squ bigger than any previous squ of any colour has been created, the player places one pyramid of her colour on each of the 4 corners of that squ (covering each of the 4 discs). This is, the pyramids are used to keep track of the largest squ of each colour. Notice that the discs covered by pyramids still count for future squs.

HOW TO WIN

When the game ends, the player with the largest squ wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trade-or-Treat
Description:
You and your friends just got back from a night of trick-or-treating and it’s time to trade candy! Everyone wants to share their favorite candy with each other. The obvious next step: an unnecessarily complex trading system. Will everyone get to try all the candy before the night ends?

Trade-or-Treat is a cooperative game where players work together towards the same goal of sharing their Halloween candy. Everyone wins if all Kids have one of each kind of Candy.

The randomized grid of Trade and Treat cards determine the ways candy can be traded in each game. Everyone takes turns performing an action to trade candy. Can you solve the puzzle and win before you run out of actions?

This game is part of a thematically linked trilogy of games. In Sweet Dreams, players are adults trying to give away all their candy first on Halloween. In Trade-or-Treat, players are kids trading the candy they got from trick-or-treating. In Cavity Calamity, players are dentists cleaning the teeth of the kids after Halloween.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sweet Dreams
Description:
It’s 9PM on Halloween and swarms of kids are still running around trick-or-treating. 9PM! This is way too late for someone to stay awake. Time to get rid of these sweets and get to sleep!

Sweet Dreams is a game where you are adults trying to give out all their candy on Halloween. The kids have specific sweets they want and arrive in a particular order. Whoever arranges their candy bowl the best wins the game.

Each player randomly gets 3 cards that you place facedown in front of you. After the game starts, you may not look at your cards again, except when cards are traded. Match the 3 Favorite cards better than your opponents to win! Toothpaste doesn’t help towards victory, unless you collect 3 of them. Then, you win with a Dentist’s Halloween!

This game is part of a thematically linked trilogy of games. In Sweet Dreams, players are adults trying to give away all their candy first on Halloween. In Trade-or-Treat, players are kids trading the candy they got from trick-or-treating. In Cavity Calamity, players are dentists cleaning the teeth of the kids after Halloween.

—description from the designer

Name: Cavity Calamity
Description:
What’s scarier than Halloween for dentists? The appointments during the month of November! To keep things interesting, you and a fellow dentist have a friendly rivalry every year after Halloween. Who can put up the best defense against all these sugary sweets?

Cavity Calamity is a game where you are dentists trying to keep your patients’ teeth clean and send kids with the most sugary candy to your rival at the same time. Whoever has the cleanest teeth wins.

You each have 13 teeth dice that you want to keep clean. Your opponent is trying to send kids to you with Halloween candy in order to rot your teeth. Draft cards and then play them on either the Rot side or Clean side. Try to take advantage of the special abilities on the cards to rot and clean efficiently!

This game is part of a thematically linked trilogy of games. In Sweet Dreams, players are adults trying to give away all their candy first on Halloween. In Trade-or-Treat, players are kids trading the candy they got from trick-or-treating. In Cavity Calamity, players are dentists cleaning the teeth of the kids after Halloween.

—description from the designer

Name: La Fallera Calavera 3: més enllà de la paella
Description:
La Fallera Calavera has proclaimed itself queen and has become a tyrant. The zombie walks through the Kingdom of La Fallera Calavera and forces her slaves to feed her. But the zombie is no longer satisfied with only paella: now she also wants the typical foods of each area!

La Fallera Calavera 3 is the second expansion of the card game La Fallera Calavera, specially well-known in the Valencian Country. This expansion includes 55 new cards and, for the first time in the series, a game board.

The board represents the map of the Kingdom of Fallera Calavera on which a pawn of La Fallera will move. In each turn, players will be able to move the Queen. This will help them to: draft cards from the board, turn on effects of some cards and change the final victory conditions of the game.

—description from the designer
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: 15 Go!
Description:
Get rid of your cards as quickly as possible, by playing the numbers subsequently. You make rows on the table but you can also play the cards on your opponent's deck. A tactical game where you have to trade and count. With 2 playable possibilities: the basic game and the advanced game. Who is the first to get rid of his cards?!

—description from the publisher

Name: Girls Night Out: The Pre-Game
Description:
Be the perfect HOST with this hilarious and risqué start to any girls gathering or bachelorette party. Your girls will love you for it. Grab some drinks and get your pre-game on!

Plays up to 6 people 
Includes 81 FUNNY question cards
24 response cards
Adults only! (NOT for kids)
Comes in a white box

Girls Night Out is a conversational game. There are two ways to play:

     Rotate reading the cards or select one person to read cards for the group. Each player gets voting cards (A, B, C, and D). Everyone votes with their card face down, then reveal. The answer with the majority wins. Players that voted for the majority get a point. Play to a predetermined number or number of rounds.
     Use the cards as conversation starters. Read each card and discuss the options. No Voting.


Variations:

     Drinking Game(21+): Instead of each player receiving a point for voting for the majority, players that didn't vote for the majority must take a drink. (Please play responsibly)
     Reveal: Each player who chose a non-majority answer must reveal an intimate secret about themselves or accept a dare from the other players.
     Three Strikes: Choose three non-majority answers and you're out of the game. Last one still in wins.
     Gambling: Each player wagers before the hose reads the answer choices for a question. If you can answer the card correctly after the options are read out loud, you win. If you win, you gain all of the points wagered. In the case of a tie, no one wins. If you lose, whoever wins will receive your points.


Example Card:
What's the worst thing that can happen at your wedding?
A. Your ex pops up
B. The groom shows up late
C. The families start fighting
D. Someone spills something on your dress

Name: Conspiracies
Description:
An electronic buzzer Party board game of hidden roles, bluffing and deductive thinking!

Tonight, every noble in the kingdom has gathered at the King’s Palace for the annual Masquerade Ball!
Colourful costumes, rich feathers, intricate masks, plenty of food and drink, and of course, crazy dancing! Unfortunately, not everyone has come to have fun... Some of the guests secretly plot against the king and have come to the dance to kill him.

Will the nobles loyal to the royal family manage to stop them, or will the king, like his predecessor, end up dead?

Bluff, “read” the other players, guess who’s your ally and who’s your opponent, speak the truth or lie - whatever suits you best - everything is allowed in your attempts to triumph in Conspiracies!

Just be careful... don’t poison the wrong person!

—description from the publisher

Name: TRACES: Downtown Crime
Description:
An electronic buzzer board game that requires deduction and tactical choices.

A heinous assassination shocks downtown city! A relentless hunt begins! 4 Police Officers, all with Different Abilities, are thrown into the Murderer’s Traces! Will they manage to find and arrest the Murderer in the first 24 hours after the crime, or will his trail get cold enough, allowing him to escape?

An asymmetric, cooperative game of deductive thinking & tactical choices, that will make you hold your breath!

—description from the publisher

Name: SPIES Operation: Europe
Description:
An electronic buzzer Party board game that requires speed, knowledge, wits and deductive thinking!

In SPIES Operation: Europe, players are superspies working for a Secret Intelligence Service. Lately, their Service has managed to intercept encrypted messages from a rival intelligence service, that describe the locations in which important objects are hidden!

Can you decode these messages by quickly understanding the locations they pinpoint? Find the correct European country on the map and swiftly place your pawn on it! If you are clueless, make sure you follow the correct opponent, so that you can steal some of his glory!

Think fast, be quick to show off your amazing knowledge, and win the title of most cosmopolitan Spy!

—description from the publisher

Name: 8-Cylinder Overlords
Description:
8-Cylinder Overlords is a game of building, defending, and attacking roads in a post-collapse world. 2-4 players take on the roles of Overlords, human brains encased in heavily-armed and armored supercars that rule over auto-worshipping Pedestrians. There are only a few Overlords left and they are racing to build a Road to a Lost City of forgotten lore and restorative technology. The first player to complete a 20-30 space long Road and drive her Overlord to the end wins the game!

Each Player draws cards from the Road deck and lays down the cards in a line to form their Road. Simple Pavement cards extend the Road. Installation cards give you many more options: Farms allow you to create more workers. Refineries create the Fuel that you must pay to build each part of your Road and to compete in the Auction phase. Fortresses allow you to attack your rivals' Roads with withering Barrages or daring and potentially lucrative Raids. Once the Card is added to the Road, Players crew their installations by placing Peds in the spaces on each card. Players then go through the breeding, refining, and attacking phases and end their turn with the option of selling any cards they don't use.

During every phase of a Player's turn, the Overlord figure has a special ability that can be used to augment the action, such as drawing more cards, motivating installations to act again, directly attacking rival Roads, and more. But each Overlord Action costs fuel from the Overlord's reserve and Players must make good choices about when to use these additional abilities.
After each round of turns, Players move to Walkerville, a neutral territory where upgrades, special power cards, more workers, and various unique actions are sold in blind auctions. If two or more players compete for a single auction item and reach the maximum bid, the issue is decided by a frantic, high-stakes Drag Race. Auction wins can dramatically turn the tide of the game and Players are encouraged to bid aggressively.

—description from the designer

Name: Scratch The Deck
Description:
Scratch The Deck: A cool card game for people who love Cats!

Be the first to get rid of all your cards, plan your end game strategically to win and be the Scratch the Deck Champion.

Each player is dealt 4 cards face up and 9 cards face down. The 4 cards  face up are to be kept in hand and the 9 cards face down cannot be seen  or used until the end of the game when there is no more deck cards to draw from (9 Lives End Game).

Each turn players must lay a card of equal or higher value than the  player before, for example: on top of a 4, you can lay a 4 or higher. If you have multiples of the same number you can lay them at the same time. If you lay 4 or more of the same number, you can Scratch the Deck (discard the pile and lay a new start card). As long as there are cards left in the deck, players must keep a  minimum of 4 cards in hand at all times, so, if you lay 2 cards, you  pick up 2, if you lay 1 card, you pick up 1.

Every time you place a card of the same value of the player before,  for example: you lay a 5 on top of a 5, you pick a card up from the  'Good Cat Bad Cat' deck. Good Cat Cards offer advantages to players that  can be helpful to the player (especially during the 9 lives end game)  and Bad Cat Cards make the game harder for the player.

Super Power Cat Cards (Can be placed on any card, almost):
1 = Can be laid on any card and is the lowest value card in the game
3 = Can be placed under the pile (Hide Card)
6 = Can be laid on any card, the next player must play a double (2 or  more cards of the same value)  or Alpha (11 or 12) card next
9 = Can be laid on any card, the next player must lay lower than a 9
10 = Can be laid on any card, the card pile is discarded and a new start card is laid (Scratch the Deck)

—description from the designer

Name: Gloom: Went Dark in the Night Promo
Description:
This is an Untimely Death Promo card for Gloom.

To play with this promo, shuffle it into the pile of cards at the beginning of the game. It adds a new Untimely Death card to the game.

The card's ability reads: [continuous effect] Worth an additional -10 with the Death icon.

This promo was released in issue #237 of Game Trade Magazine.

Name: Who am I?
Description:
Who am I? is a deduction game where player's goal is to deduce the animal and two pieces of clothing an opponent is holding. On a player turn, they can give an animal card to opponent who then has to answer if any of the pictured items match their hidden cards. After collecting enough evidence that a player can prove any of the hidden cards, they can do so. Finding out all three hidden cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Alubari: A Nice Cup of Tea – Promo Cards
Description:
Received them at Spiel 2019 in Essen at the Studio H Booth.
4 additional equpiment cards.

The Post Train
Town Market
Chaiwala's Assistant
Chai Boiler

Name: Exagon
Description:
Exagon is an abstract tile laying game. Players distribute hexagonal tiles equally between them and start placing them in such way that edges match to neighboring pieces. If only one edge matches, the turn is over. If two or more edges match, that player has a 60 second sand timer to place as many tiles as they can match in a similar way. First to get rid of their tiles is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Ghoullotine
Description:
Ghoullotine is a fast and ghoulish card game with some themes inspired by the likes of Blackjack.

Each player has a hand of 3 cards that they must use to the best of their ability. During a player’s turn, they will play 1 card from their hand, it’s number is added to the total. Then, if the total is above “13”, then that player is removed from the game. If the total isn’t higher than “13”, then the effect of the card activates. Such effects may be the “Witch’s” ability to swap hands with another player or the “Ghoul’s” ability to skip a player’s next turn.

This game has a surprising amount of tricks and tactics to employ, that’ll keep you addicted to this treat of a game.

—description from the designer

Name: Shifting Realms: Darkness Revealed
Description:
Shifting Realms: Darkness Revealed is an expansion to Shifting Realms.  A copy of Shifting Realms is necessary to play Darkness Revealed.  The base game includes 5 realms which are played 3 at a time offering 10 realm combinations and 60 unique board layouts.  Shifting Realms:Darkness Revealed comes with 2 additional realms bringing the number of realm combinations to 35 with 210 board layouts.

The two new realms in Darkness Revealed are Knossos and Gehenna.  Each realm comes with a board, structures, story cards, and task cards.  The new realms introduce new synergies, mechanisms, and components to the base game.

Knossos, the undiscovered land of the minotaurs, introduces Search tiles and Labyrinth walls.  Players need to search areas of the board to recover treasure before structures can be built in the realm.  Players can place Labyrinth walls to block movement and building adjacency.  Players also start the game drafting story cards which ramps up the first few turns of the game.

Gehenna, the dark land of the demons, offers players ways to directly interfere with the other players. Building Demon Towers enables players to capture opposing players units for victory points.  Many of the story cards in this realm enable players to move opponents’ units within the realms.

—description from the designer

Name: Unstable Unicorns: Creature Master Unicorn Promo Card
Description:
A Kickstarter Exclusive card to add to your Unstable Unicorns game! If you were a backer of one of Ramy Badie's (Unstable Games's) previous campaigns, this card was automatically included in your rewards as part of the "Runes & Regulations" campaign. It was also available as an add-on.

Card text:
Magical Unicorn card
"When this card enters your Stable, you may DISCARD 2 cards, then choose 2 Unicorn cards from the discard pile and add them to your hand."

Name: Cats on a Tower
Description:
Playing as one of several cats competing for the affection of The Owner, it’s up to you to become the best cat in the house in this Take That game of simple rules but interesting choices. 
 Play your cards right to balance your cuteness, your hoard of treats, and your ability to be the highest on the tower when the round suddenly ends!

—description from the designer

The goal of the game is to secure 3 or more victory points.  Points are earned in 3 ways when a round ends: being the cutest, being the highest on a large Cat Tower, or by having the most treats.  A Can opener card is hidden in the bottom half of the deck, and as soon as it's revealed, the round ends.  Unless someone has 3+ Points, a new round starts.

Cards can be played in 3 ways:

     Play and apply the effect (usually maneuvering on the tower, influencing players treats, or adding to cuteness at a cost).
     Played face down to add 1 to your cuteness.
     Discarded to gain 2 treats from the bowl.

Name: Runes & Regulations: Unstable Unicorn Promo Card
Description:
Anybody who backed a previous Kickstarter campaign for Ramy Badie (Unstable Games / TeeTurtle) received this Unstable Unicorn promo card for Runes & Regulations as part of the Runes & Regulations Kickstarter campaign. This was also available as an add-on.

Card text:
"Unstable Unicorn:
TRIGGER - A Mythical Creature on your Lawn is destroyed, hexed, or stolen;
EFFECT - DESTROY a Creature."

Name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Shadow Council's Blessing
Description:
Promo card for Clank Legacy given away in conventions

Event :

Each Player roll a d20 and gets the following :
1 : +2 clank
2-12 : 1 coin
13-19 : 2 coins
20 : 5 coins

Name: Runes & Regulations: Kickstarter Exclusive Card Pack
Description:
1 Kickstarter Exclusive: Stunning Kitsune
1 Kickstarter Exclusive: Mischievous Kelpie
1 Kickstarter Exclusive: Phoenixi
2 customizable Regulation cards
2 customizable Spell cards
2 customizable Creature cards.

Name: 18Dracula
Description:
18Dracula is a print-and-play 18XX board game where the players buy and sell shares in fronts, and operate those fronts to hire monsters to send on rampages to harvest blood. The winner is the player who is worth the most blood at the end of the game - being their blood supply, and the combined value of their shares in fronts.

Functionally, the game is very close to being a retheme of 1830. Despite lacking trains, it is very much a train game.

Besides its theme, it is also novel for its map, monsters (which replace trains), and associates (which replace privates). The map uses cubes and nodes instead of tiles (like most 18xx games). You clear routes by removing cubes from the routes.

Some monsters have special rules - such as a ghost being able to pass through a token, or a werewolf that roams adjacent towns instead of a solid route. Associates have some odd abilities, like opening a route between any two towns.

—description from the designer

Name: Forest Fire!: A Family Game
Description:
Available from TheGameCrafter at https://thegamecrafter.com/games/forest-fire-?
The rules are available online at https://www.ideategames.org/forestfire/forestfire_rules.pdf

Forest Fire! was inspired by a little boy who loves fighting fires. The game is set in a densely wooded yet populated area where forest fires often occur. When fires start, players work together to put them out and save houses and schools from destruction.

Players use several fire fighting approaches – bulldozers, water, helicopters and chemical extinguishers. Fires occur randomly (FOREST FIRE cards) and spread every turn. Wind changes direction and intensity frequently, affecting the spread of the fires. Players contain the fires with bulldozer firebreaks and throw water and fire extinguisher balls (fire retardant) on the fires by hand or from a helicopter.

As the game progresses, environmental factors like wind and drought increase, affecting the frequency, intensity, and spreading speed of fires, simulating the effects of climate change.

We noted the other game of the same name and same setting, but the play mechanics are very different. This is not a strategy game, but a fairly simple but exciting family game.

—description from the designer

Name: Settlers of Catan Scenario: The Jungle
Description:
Use the hidden secrets of the primordial jungle to further your quest for victory.

- After the board has been set up, replace the Desert tile with the special Jungle tile (see Additional Components).

Select a number token (in addition to the number tokens already placed on the island) whose value is 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, or 11. All players must agree on which number to use. Place this number token on the Jungle hex.

The Robber begins the game on the Jungle hex.

- Special Rules
The Jungle
During the game, players may explore the Jungle and make valuable discoveries. The discoveries will aid them in developing their principalities. When the number on the token that was placed in the Jungle is rolled on the production dice, each player with settlements or cities adjacent to the Jungle will make discoveries!

Like other land hexes, each settlement adjacent to the Jungle will receive one discovery when the Jungle number is rolled. Likewise, each city adjacent to the Jungle will receive two discoveries.

-Discoveries
Discoveries are not represented by cards as other resources are. Instead, they are represented by the Discovery Counters. Discovery Counters do not count against a player's hand limit of resources when a "7" is rolled on the production roll.

Discovery Counters can not be stolen by the Robber, can not be claimed by a Monopoly, can not be earned through a Year of Plenty, and may not be used in any trades.

Discovery Counters are used to aid the purchase of development cards. Each Discovery Counter can be used to replace any one of the three resources needed to purchase a card. Up to three Discovery Counters may be used on each card purchase.

Any combination of Discovery Counters and the three normal resources may be used.

For Example: a player may purchase a Development Card with one Ore and two Discovery Counters. Similarly, a Discovery Card could be purchased with one wool, one grain, and one discovery counter.

III. Components
In addition to all of the normal components of the Settlers game, you will need three additional components:

1 Jungle Hexagon
Discovery Counters (about 10 should be enough, the Victory Point Tokens from Seafarers work very well for this purpose)
1 additional resource number token (valued 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, or 11)

Name: Settlers of Catan Scenario: The Volcano
Description:
Brave the hazards of the Volcano's fury to fill your coffers with gold!

The Volcano tile replaces the Desert tile and during the game the volcano may erupt! When it does, settlers who are unfortunate enough to be in the path of the lava will be swept away!

During setup, a number is placed on the Volcano (it cannot be 7). When the number on the token that was placed on the Volcano is rolled, the Volcano erupts!

Special Rules
Setup
During the initial construction turns, no player may place either of his two starting settlements on an intersection that borders the Volcano.

The Volcano
When the Volcano erupts, roll a die to determine the direction the lava will flow. One of the six intersections on the Volcano tile will be affected. If there is a settlement on the selected intersection, it is destroyed!

Remove it from the board (its owner may rebuild it later). If a city is located there, it is reduced to a settlement! Replace the city with a settlement of its owner's color. If he has no settlements remaining, it is destroyed instead.

The presence of the Robber on the Volcano hex does not prevent the Volcano from erupting.

Gold Variant
Important: This is an optional rule. All players must agree to this rule if it is to be used.

Volcanoes tend to be rich in valuable minerals such as gold or gems. If the players desire, the Volcano can produce resources when its number is rolled.

This "gold" is distributed in the same manner as the Gold River hex in the Seafarers expansion: Each settlement that is adjacent to the Volcano when it erupts may produce any one of the five resources it's owner desires.

Each city adjacent to the Volcano may produce any two resources. This resource production is taken before the results of the volcano eruption are resolved. Note that while the Robber can not prevent the Volcano from erupting, he does prevent any player from producing resources from the Volcano hex if he has been placed there.

-Playing with the Seafarers Expansion
When playing the Volcano scenario with the seafarers expansion, the Volcano tile can replace any desert or sea tile that all players agree on. The only restriction is that whichever tile is replaced by the Volcano must be adjacent to at least two other resource-producing land tiles.

-Krakatoa Variant
This variant is for use only with the Seafarers expansion. For this variant, form an island from three Volcano tiles. Place resource number tokens 4, 5, and 6 one on each Volcano.

This variant should only be used with the Gold Variant described above.

Name: Tank Hunter: Girls and Panzer Edition
Description:
This game combines the rules of Tank Hunter 2E with art and tanks from the Girls & Panzer series. The rules are the same as Tank Hunter 2E, but with some parts removed to make for an easier to learn and more streamlined game.

At the start of the game each player is dealt five tanks and one event card, and then you draft those to determine your starting hand. All tanks start out face down, but only face up tanks can attack or be attacked. You can flip your own tanks face up at any time, but you'll need to scout to force other players to flip up their tanks. Each turn you can attack, scout, or pass to draw an event card.

When you destroy a tank you collect it and it counts for points at the end of the game, with stronger tanks being worth more points. The game ends when all but one player run out of tanks or after the third Boco event card comes out, and whoever has the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Metro Lines
Description:
Metro Lines is a 1 to 2 player tile placement game where you or "you and your opponent" are city transit planners and your job is to create the longest metro line route from station to station across the city.

GAME PLAY - SOLO PLAY
The object of the game is to play all sixteen cards to create a continuous visible Metro line route using all the cards and having each station color used at  least twice.  The game consists of 16 turns with each turn representing "one card being played".  The game ends when the last card is placed on the table.

—description from the designer

Name: Reckless Daring: Brigade Level Minatures Rules for the Colonial Age 1870-1910
Description:
Reckless Daring is a complete rules system to refight colonial era battles at the brigade level from 1870 to 1910.  Covers the Sudan, Indian Mutiny, Boer Wars, Ashanti Wars, Zulu Wars, Dahomey Wars, Abyssinian Wars and the Sahara.  Army lists, army guides, painting guides and scenario for Omdurman are included

—description from the publisher

Name: Rugby Glory
Description:
The first collectible & customizable rugby card game, RUGBY GLORY is a fast-paced expandable card game (ECG) with rugby ball dice that covers all the key aspects of your favorite sport in a challenging & exciting format that is fun for ages 10-100.

Rugby Glory is a 2-player (or team) deck-building card game with dice that strikes the balance between luck and strategy, and follows all the laws of rugby union, making it a great tool for players learning the game or coaches looking to improve player understanding of the sport. Run, pass, kick or support your teammates with streamlined gameplay full of interesting choices.

Whether you are a life-long rugby player/fan, someone new to this glorious sport, or a curious board gamer unfamiliar with the game of rugby but looking for challenging table-top fun, RUGBY GLORY has you covered!

—description from the designer

Name: Super Power
Description:
Super Power is a card set with special rules for 30 of the best Pegasus games of all time! The special thing about it: After using a Super Power card, the owner has to give it to one of her/his fellow players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Expedition to Newdale: The Pfistries
Description:
When playing with character cards, you can add Master Pfister to the pool. When you play Master Pfister, you will need the three Pfistry cards (#211).

The Master Pfister is a new character card that adds three new (Pfistry) buildings to the display. Pfistries are worth 3VP, and they chain grain and coal to make bread.

Promo cards available at Essen Spiel 2019

Name: MAiAK
Description:
MAiAK is a brisk, strategic turn-based game for 2 players with a variable game board in an elegant design wooden box.

Each player has five game stones (black vs. white) at the beginning of the game.

The goal of the game is to get one game piece to the opposite side of the game board before the opponent does. Sounds simple, but try it for yourself.

MAiAK uniquely combines the gaming principles of checkers, chess and pentago to create a whole new level of strategic thinking.

MAiAK is simply for everyone.

It attracts both older players who have already played some games and younger players, even younger than 5 years. Older players will enjoy the charm of discovering different strategies, and the youngest players will use a rather elegant educational design to practice fine finger work and to recognize different shapes and colors.

PACKAGE CONTAINS:

Wooden game board, consisting of 25 colored play fields, 10 game stones and instructions in Czech, English and German language, all in an elegant wooden case.

Name: Corps Command Campaigns: Campaign Scenarios and Rules for the Age of Napoleon – 3rd Edition
Description:
A complete Campaign system for the Napoleonic Wars for Miniatures.  Covers the period between 1792 and 1815 with army lists, leader ratings, campaign rules, and a campaign map.  Can be used with any Napoleonic Tactical system or with Corps Command 3.0 from HR GAMES.  Combine it with Line of Battle, the naval rules, for the complete package.

—description from the publisher

Name: With Washington To Glory: Rules for the American Revolution 1776-1783
Description:
With Washington To Glory is a complete Tactical system for wargaming the American Revolution.  Covers the period from 1775 thru 1784 at the brigade level.  Some of the features include:     

     Allows for a 20,000 man game to be completed in 3-4 hours
     Can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed
     Features HRG’s Terrain Generation system
     Follows historical organization and unit capabilities
     Includes Battle of Newtown Scenario
     Rated Leaders
     Point system


—description from the publisher

Name: Corps Command IV: Warfare in the Age of Napoleon
Description:
Corps Command 30th Anniversary rallies once more in this enhanced Deluxe Edition!  A complete and comprehensive Napoleonic system designed for detail, fast play and the “feel of playing Napoleonics!”  

    Allows for a 40,000 man game to be completed in 3-4 hours
    Can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed
    All major and minor nation’s Army lists 
    Features HRG’s Terrain Generation system
    Follows historical organization and unit capabilities
    Includes a Scenario generator and player aid tools


Dozens of Rated Leaders for Corps and Division command
Command at the Divisional Level with smallest unit a Battalion
Includes two scenarios with more available online

—description from the publisher

Name: Yukimura Gaiden Episode 0
Description:
A tactical level wargame that covers some battles of the Osaka Siege summer campaign (1615), the day before the final battle.
The title is taken from the Japanese popular culture hero "Yukimura Sanada" who was a commanding samurai at the siege of Osaka. A "gaiden" is a tale.

The basic game engine is from Yukimura Gaiden (episode 1). Some rules were changed to fit to the smaller battlefield.
Each player controls either the Tokugawa shogunate or Toyotomi clan forces.

The game include four scenarios: two historical "Battle of Yao Wakae" and "Battle of Domyoji", a fictional situation "Domyoji", a combined scenario of these two battles.
The victory condition varies in each scenario, such as elimination of leaders or crossing of a river.

Number of counters:     252 pieces 
Maps:    2 half
Game time: May 6, 1615 
Playing time:    2-3 hours 
Number of players:     2 people

(translated and adapted from publisher's and user's description)



Notes:
 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Osaka
 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanada_Yukimura
 Gaiden:    https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaiden / https://jisho.org/word/%E5%A4%96%E4%BC%9D

Name: Check Your 6! Jet Age: Tonkin Gulf Yacht Club
Description:
Tonkin Gulf Yacht Club is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check Your 6 Jet Age  Air Combat and Campaign Rules. The book provides comprehensive coverage of the clashes between the United States Navy and North Vietnam’s Peoples Air Force between 1965 and 1968 during Operation Rolling Thunder with four campaigns, a mini-campaign and 28 scenarios. The scenarios can be played individually, linked to form campaigns, or combined as one grand campaign. The campaigns cover the battles that occurred during the annual southern monsoon fighting season.  The missions changed during the course of Rolling Thunder, so each campaign is different.

The first campaign 1965: Hard Lessons Relearned covers the initial battles between the USN and VPAF and the failures of initial tactics and weapons at the start of Rolling Thunder.

The second campaign 1966: The Grind covers the period where the operational failure of Rolling Thunder’s restrictions became clear to the men fighting even as their weapons and tactics improved, the skill of the VPAF improved as well.

The third campaign 1967: The Gloves Come Off covers the period where many of Rolling Thunder’s restrictions were lifted, large strikes on VPAF airfields and the push to destroy the VPAF. Included within this campaign period is the mini-campaign “A Birthday Gift for Uncle Ho” covering the Bon Homme Richard’s audacious mission to deliver Walleye glide bombs to a power plant in downtown Hanoi, and the running air battle that ensued.

The fourth campaign 1968: The End of the Beginning covers the period post Tet Offensive, the US ended their operations over the heart of North Vietnam, and thereby created a safe haven for VPAF MiGs North of the 19th Parallel. The VPAF began to sweep south and with bait and killer teams, and the Navy had to change tactics again, counter to these attacks till the end of Operation Rolling Thunder.
